definitions: To offer something for sale or auction.
To suggest or propose something for consideration.
To increase the price or value of something.
examples: They put up a new fence around the garden.
The house was put up for sale last week.
Can you put me up for the night?
He put up a good argument for his case.
We put up the decorations for the party.
The company put up their prices again.
pastTenses: put something up, put something up
